item.title: Noelle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Noelle add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Mothers are all slightly insane." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "In search of my mother's garden, I found my own." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Noelle add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "When Jack Burns needed to hold his mother's hand, his fingers could see in the dark." -- John Irving

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "My mother was French Protestant, and my father was Italian Catholic, and their union was an excess of God, guilt and sauce." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "They sicken of the calm who know the storm." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Noelle add a quote by George Meredith
item.description: "A witty woman is a treasure; a witty beauty is a power." -- George Meredith

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "you boys can keep your virgins give me hot old women in high heels with asses that forgot to get old." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Why is it," he said, one time, at the subway entrance, "I feel I've known you so many years?" "Because I like you," she said, "and I don't want anything from you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Constant use had not worn ragged the fabric of their friendship." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Suzanne Weyn
item.description: "Your life is an occasion. Rise to it." -- Suzanne Weyn

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Noelle add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Freddie experienced the sort of abysmal soul-sadness which afflicts one of Tolstoy's Russian peasants when, after putting in a heavy day's work strangling his father, beating his wife, and dropping the baby into the city's reservoir, he turns to the cupboards, only to find the vodka bottle empty." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Noelle add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Noelle add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann
